alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:55PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Sheridan County through 230 PM MDT... At 153 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Dayton, or 10 miles west of Sheridan, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail, along with very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized low land flooding is possible due to the heavy rainfall. Locations impacted include... Ranchester, Dayton and Parkman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
